comments.commentBody:
mancuroc:

Bush should serve as a reminder that Americans don't like it when their president lies to them. In fact, they never forget it. And the more it's denied, the angrier they get.
Someone needs to convince Senator Warren to run!!
Instead of the spectre of Hillary let's look to positive examples such as the Kennedys and FDR. They were rich and priviledged but still managed to champion the common person.
There are no such leaders as those "not corrupted by money".

Let's not forget that Chelsea Clinton and her husband have become wealthy via hedge fund positions as well as family connections and live in a Ten Million Dollar Condo possibly helped by their now ultra wealthy parents. I hope people remember this if Hillary decides to run for the Presidential office and think seriously whether she will represent the majority of the people of the United States instead of the 1%.
We need leaders who are not corrupted by money to head this country and will instead fight for equal rights financially for everyone. Otherwise we will continue to be bled to death and even witness the toppling of the gigantic overload of those comparatively few people who are running things into the ground.

I don't get it.  Why do you stick around?  Have you tried other churches?  There are many that are as loving, caring, and RESPECTFUL towards ALL kinds of people.  And they can equal the Catholics in pageantry and ceremony.  And while there will *still* be annoying church ladies (more omniscient than God) after a few services, you will wonder why you didn't do it sooner.

Pope Francis' has expressed progressive thoughts that would never have come from the mouths of his predecessors but he needs to understand that many of the faithful who still attend Mass do so despite, not because of, the Vatican.   At the parish level, even minor women's roles in the Mass are actually tolerated less than in recent years.

A vast amount of research shows that people from countries with high income inequality have higher stress levels, which leads to greater health and social issues. More equal countries (low income inequality) have:

-longer life expectancy
-lower drug abuse
-less mental illness
-greater trust in each other
-higher educational scores
-lower homicide rates
-lower crimes and rates of imprisonment
-lower infant mortality rate
-lower teen birth rate
-lower obesity rate

http://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/about-inequality/effects

Salutations John, I know the guy and part of the relevance but it is far too early to lift the avatar gag order, no mea CULPA here. Some may be EGGED on if I were to hint that the guy's name is in my comment.

Rita:

A shocking and embarrassing dereliction of their duty.

****
Precisely the cause of the hearings.

Having seen Trey Gowdy in House hearings on CSPAN and in interviews I think appointing him to lead this committee will turn out to be bad PR for the Republicans. On MSM interviews after this appointment I saw he do what I've never seen before from him: play the altar boy bit.

If the witnesses give direct clear truthful answers it will terribly frustrate Representative Gowdy. His usual modus operandi is to scold and badger witnesses. Expect him to prevent "hostile" -- to his prejudgments -- witnesses from actually being able to give complete answers. Somebody should start a betting pool to see how long it takes him to drop his new found gentle demeanor and crank up his typical histrionics for the camera.
I've seen Gowdy as a prosecutor years ago. He is a man to be feared when bringing a case to trial and conviction.
Perhaps a few wise Dems could neutralize the nonsense, and raise their own questions on House accountability to the nation in keeping votes away from the floor.

"Both actions stem from the same impulse: a need to rouse the most fervent anti-Obama wing of the party and keep it angry enough to deliver its donations and votes to Republicans in the November elections."

The Republican Party, as a whole, is fervently anti-Obama. It always has been. Just look at its leaders. Have McConnell, Cornyn, Boehner or Cantor ever been anything but anti-Obama?

The MSM misrepresents the Republican Party as basically stable but hampered by the crazy Tea Party wing, when in fact, they've merged and the Tea Partiers simply represent how conservative the GOP actually is. They give voice to the true political agenda Congerssional Republicans support but would rather hide with voter-friendly, less inflammatory rhetoric.

Trey Gowdy, who will head the Select House Committee reflects this. He is extremely conservative. He helped draft legislation to give the House the power to sue President Obama if the members voted he was not adequately enforcing laws.

He is also a very accomplished litigator and Democrats might be foolish to boycott this committee. Unchecked, he has the ability to make this circus appear to be exactly what it is not - an actual investigation.

"Poverty is the worst form of violence" - Gandhi.

versus

"Ask not what your country can do for you,..." JFK

....Ask what you can do for the filthy rich oligarchs who own this country, and merely allow you to live on the premises provided you work to maintain them, don't draw to many resources to yourself away from them and keep quite and eat your gruel with gratitude and reverence to them.

We need to put this job creating meme in perspective. The slave holders in the South, they were job creators for the slaves. Moreover, it is quite obvious that these people don't view their duty as creating jobs, else everyone would have one.

We need high wealth taxes as well as income taxes but I'm happy to compromise with the calvinist compromise of huge estate taxes. We can have a high threshold before they kick in, $20 million, but after that taxed at 95%.

Likewise we should have a maximum income from salaries (as opposed to paid for performance of artist, entertainers, atheletes, in entors and people who start new businesses, who should still be taxed at the Eisenhower rate). Armand Hammer once said that a person making $400,000 lived about as well as he did. Adjusted for inflation, that's about $2 million today, so a ceiling of $10 million is more than adequate for a CEO, CIO, or Fund Manager to live comfortably. If they want to make more they can take the risk of moving overseas. And high salaries should be taxed at the Eisenhower rate.

When Reagan got to Washington, greed became good. When Bush II came to Washington, the middle class became the ultimate prey to feed a never ending gob stopper of greed .

The finance industry has grown into one gigantic. perpetual 'bubble blower' that blows bubbles at will, markets them to the innocent unknowing, surgically extracts inflated value before each bubble bursts, and then starts the process all over again.

We need to re-tune the economy to serve more than just a small percentage of the people, and to produce 'real wealth', not skimmed wealth.

Not only do hedge fund managers rake it in because of lax regulation of the financial industry, but they've managed to arrange for their fee income to be taxed at capital gains rates as "carried interest." What is striking about the recovery --- such as it is --- from the Great Recession is that these guys and most others in the financial industry landed on their feet and are now making money faster than ever, while millions of less affluent Americans, many of whom were just innocent bystanders to the financial games, have lost jobs, homes, and any realistic hope for the future. That's reverse Robin Hoodism with a vengeance!

In pre-Reagan days, the very wealthy were subject to a top income tax of at least 70 percent and at one point as high as 94 percent, and after allowing for loopholes (of which there weren't so many in those days) and other deduction, the top effective tax rate of the rich was at least 50 percent. But we won't see those rates again unless Congrees acts in the greater interest of the nation, and that won't happen as long as Republicans and too many Democrats are so beholden to our billionaire class. ALL individual and corporate donations to political campaigns should be limited to $100, with no end runs allowed, and radio and TV should be required to carry a limited amount of free political advertising, but don't hold your breath for serious campaign finance reform to happen.

Do we want a government of, by, and for the rich, or one for the people?

Now those twenty five have control of 20 Billions of dollars, of which say, some 15 billions is free to invest, to acquire more assets to make them more money.

And the mentioned kindergarten teachers, earn some ten billions of dollars, and probably have only some 300 millions of dollars to invest in income producing assets.

And, our tax code does not restrain the investment choices of the 25 hedge fund managers, to force the use of their excess capital into infrastructure investments for the good of all society.

But, the investment choices of the teachers are by and large constrained by the amounts that can be put through the investment conduits available and regulated not to provide consumer protection, but for maximum exposure to hedge fund marketing.

So, what the Right would see of this situation is: the kindergarten teachers are overpaid if they have time to worry about access to investment choices.

However, the kindergarten teachers, many, people dependent upon a government check for their income, are expected to do their bit to secure the credit of the national asset known as the American Taxpayer when asked to bail out the financial "Industry" 's profligate losses to avoid global economic collapse.

Really. Is this the best that WE, as Americans, can choose for a legacy to our descendants?

[[BronxBronx
I'm happy for you - that you can laugh to keep from crying. I hope you never have to understand why a self indulgent, sad faced woman holding up a piece of paper with a message scrawled on it, holds more meaning to the women reading it than you'll ever be able to comprehend.
May 8, 2014 at 10:43 p.m.]]

And I'm happy for you that you think the fanatics of Boko Haram will be swayed by Michelle's sad face.

I think the people of Nigeria know their military is weak and their government is indecisive. I think we'll have better luck with the highly trained military personnel her husband sent into country.

Have a nice day.

And good luck to the photographer.

Absolutely correct if and only if the form of government intervention is at least adequate, if not optimal. The best form of fisheries management is individual transferable quotas, just as the best form of climate change mitigation is carbon pricing. The further you get away from that the higher the costs, and the lower the benefits, of intervention. At its limit - as in fisheries management in Europe or the climate change policy of the Abbott Government in Australia - it is very doubtful if the government intervention is worth it at all.
AACNY:  You mean the cause of the hearings is the Republicans' shocking and embarrassing dereliction of their duty, right?  (If not, you're way out in right-field foul territory.)
Elizabeth Warren is indeed a "national treasure" and hopefully, our next POTUS.
So how do we find these people who are not corrupted by money?

Johnny
Watch Eli's first year in the league.
And the point of the article is proven.

"Parents are smart...."

I agree, and am grateful that the overwhelming majority of them are thoughtful and considerate enough to have their children vaccinated.
I think people weren't so much educated into the current screening protocols as they were frightened into them.
Thank you Mr. Beschloss.  A very enjoyable read and a refreshing change of pace.

Some "small tumors" will never become "large tumors". In fact, they will stay the same for decades. We still don't have good methods for differentiating this kind of tumor from more aggressive tumors that will grow quickly. Meanwhile, some women will get treatment for a tumor that was not going to grow. I do see a problem with that.

FYI, I highly doubt these bacteria can actually create protein out of these synthetic nucleic acids. Furthermore, you can take antiobiotics to kill the bacteria (except for the one to which they are resistant to, of course). This has nothing to do with arrogance, we use bacteria for all sorts of things all the time. To make proteins, drugs, chemicals, to learn about the body in new ways, etc. This is just one lab of thousands across the world that uses bacteria, so um ya....

I am involved with research where we utilize bacteria; thousands of labs in the world do research with bacteria. There are strict safety protocols in place to ensure that bacteria do not get out, though the kind of bacteria they are using is not something you should be worried about anyway.

They have the right to concern themselves, but they their concerns should be met with limited reception. After all, my layperson's concern about the safety of air travel(due to my neurotic/fearful ignorance) does not mean my opinions should hold any value in the conversation about the safety of air travel. I have the right to my concern, absolutely, but should anyone value my concerns? Probably not.
